H0.text: Calorie is the unit used to express the amount of energy in food.

H1.text: Degree Celsius is the unit used to express the amount of energy in food.

H2.text: Milliliter is the unit used to express the amount of energy in food.

H3.text: Gram is the unit used to express the amount of energy in food.

A4.text: In nutrition, the large unit calorie, also called kilocalorie, is used to express food energy.

A6.text: The 'large' unit is also used to express recommended nutritional intake or consumption, as in 'calories per day'.

A7.text: The small calorie or gram calorie is defined as the amount of heat needed to cause the same increase in one milliliter of water.
